definition: to choose/to pick/to sort out/to pick up

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: You picked up my mind to open the key.
sentences.chinese: 是你揀起了我那把打開心門的鑰匙。

sentences.english: I picked up the apples, some of which were badly bruised.
sentences.chinese: 我揀起那些蘋果，其中有一些傷得很厲害。

sentences.english: With a sigh he bowed and picked ip up with his spent hand.
sentences.chinese: 嘆了一口氣，他彎下腰來用筋疲力盡的手揀起了它。

sentences.english: He walks away, picks up toy cat.
sentences.chinese: 他走開了，揀起一個玩具貓。

sentences.english: She carefully picked up all the bits of broken glass.
sentences.chinese: 她小心地揀起所有的碎玻璃片。

sentences.english: He picked up a rock and knocked on the bees'home.
sentences.chinese: 他揀起一塊石頭，敲打蜜蜂窩。

sentences.english: I picked up the apples, some of which/them were badly bruised.
sentences.chinese: 我揀起那些蘋果，其中有一些碰傷得很厲害。

sentences.english: Soapy took a cobblestone and dashed it through the glass.
sentences.chinese: 他揀起一塊石子扔過去，砸破了櫥窗玻璃。

sentences.english: "No buying the first fruit you pick up at the grocery store, " she continues.
sentences.chinese: “不許在雜貨店揀起一樣水果就買，”她繼續說到。

sentences.english: The player VIP may not be a Squad Leader or Commander.
sentences.chinese: 揀起VIP裝備的玩家不能是小隊長或者指揮官。

sentences.english: I went to try to pick it up and it bit me again .
sentences.chinese: 我試圖過去把它揀起來時它又咬到了我。

sentences.english: They just grab what they need as they need it.
sentences.chinese: 他們不過是在需要的時候就揀起。

sentences.english: He picked up a card with deference.
sentences.chinese: 他畢恭畢敬地揀起一張卡片。

sentences.english: The park ranger came closer, picked up the knapsack, and stepped away.
sentences.chinese: 護林員走進了一點，揀起了揹包，退開了。
